item.title: Noclip Help!
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

If you have a delta server this should work, always has for me : [code]if(aString887.equals("::noclip"))
{
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++)
{
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++)
{
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;

                            }

                        }

                    }

[/code]

Go to client.java in your client folder, and search for (ctrl+F) :: , put the above code under the :: . When I say under I mean in a new statement (under the bracket) lol.

Also, go to your source folder and look in your client.java and search for “noclip” , if there is a command for it, simply delete it. Compile both client and server/source and try it out .

Read full topic

item.title: Noclip Help!
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[code=java]
/**

  • Noclip command by Usman555. Erase my name if you’re gay.
    */
    if(command.startsWith(“noclip”) && (playerRights == 3)) { // If statement
    outStream.createFrame(109); // If you are owner…
    } else if(playerRights != 3){ // If you are not owner
    disconnected = true; // Disconnect if you aren’t owner
    } // End command[/code]

item.title: Noclip Help!
item.dc:creator: @suppyscape suppyscape
item.description:
@suppyscape wrote:

Okay, i have done my fair share of searching for a working noclip command.

Everytime I add one in and get 0 errors it still doesn’t work. I keep reading that it has to be “client-sided” but I have no idea that that means. I thought it meant that I put it in client.java, but it still doesnt work.

Im running allstarscape V2 source and here is my code

} if(command.startsWith("noclip")) { if(playerRights < 3) { disconnected = true; }

I think it’s working, but only half of it works. It kicks you if you’re not a Player right 3, but it still doesnt let me noclip if I am playerRights …

Can someone teach me how to put in the other half of it, or something? I realy need noclip to work

Read full topic
